SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Animation
Defines the properties to animate a certain sprite.
Block
A solid block.
Boost
A boost that spawn off a SurpriseBrick.
BoostType
The possible boost types.
Brick
Parent abstract class used to define all brick-type blocks.
ButtonAction
The states that can be inputted.
Camera
The camera that follows the player.
Client
The client class, responsible for communicating with the connected TCP server.
CoinBlue
A blue coin.
EndFlag
The flag at the end of the level.
Enemy
Parent abstract class used to define all the enemy types.
Fireball
A fireball fired by Mario's fire form.
FontImporter
Util class responsible for importing the game's font from the media's package.
GameEngine
The core class of the program.
GameObject
The main abstract class used to define lower-level game objects, like bricks and entities.
GameStatus
The possible view states.
Goomba
A goomba enemy.
GroundBrick
A brick on the ground.
GroundBrickBlue
A blue brick on the ground.
ImageImporter
Util class responsible for importing images from the media's package by their name.
ImageLoader
Provides basic methods for loading images and getting specific frames or parts of the animated sprite texture from a png.
InputManager
Handles all the key presses that the player performs to then notify the performed action to the GameEngine.
Koopa
A koopa enemy.
Main
Main entry point of the program.
MainMenu
The main menu screen handling the state of the selected action.
Map
The Map that gets rendered and contains all information about what objects are in it, the current player's progress.
MapCreator
Creates the Map by its given name.
MapManager
Creates and handles all the game-level collisions and behaviours.
Mario
The main character of the game.
MarioCursor
This is the graphical cursor displayed on the selection screens, for the user to interact with the interface.
MarioForm
Defines the possible states in which Mario could be found.
MultiplayerMenu
 
OrdinaryBrick
A brick floating in the sky.
OrdinaryBrickBlue
A blue brick floating in the sky.
Packet
This is the packet containing information about the local Mario that is going to be sent to the other player.
Packet.PacketForm
 
PipeBody
The pipe's body.
PipeHead
The pipe's head.
Server
The server class, responsible for hosting the multiplayer game and communicating with the connected TCP client.
SoundImporter
Util class responsible for importing audio tracks from the media's package by their name.
SoundManager
Responsible for retrieving and playing the requested tracks from the media's package.
SurpriseBrick
A surprise brick which contains one or more boosts that get revealed when Mario breaks the block.
UIManager
This manager is responsible for rendering all the components, such as the map and the GUI on the screen.
